fields.description:
We have so many versions and don't want to delete them as it would affect our reporting integrity. It would be helpful if the versions were automatically categorized (like workflow statuses are) into Unreleased, released, and archived.  Therefore, allowing the user to expand the latter two if they want to see details.  But, in a case where there are hundreds of versions - most actually archived, going to that page can be overwhelming to locate the version and also drag them into appropriate areas to help keep it manageable. 

BTW - This is the only link I have to log JIRA requests, even though I know most are not specific to OnDemand. It's the link provided in our Jira UI under Help and Support.
fields.summary: Auto consolidation of versions: Unreleased, Released, and Archive

fields.description:
As an Atlassian OnDemand company administrator
I want to be able to configure the default home page that shows up for all users after login to be the Confluence homepage instead of the JIRA homepage
so that most users do not have to do extra clicks to get to their real "homepage" as most users are not interested in the issues view in their daily work.

As side notes:
The Confluence homepage is even much more flexible to be configured than the JIRA homepage. In Confluence I can choose any page to be the homepage.
And no, it is not an option to just don't give application access to JIRA to most of the users (which would default Confluence to be their homepage), as they first are rare users (not non-users) and second we do have an open information policy internally, so everybody should be able to see (almost) everything.

This is about their landing page and not restricting information access.

*Note:* This has been deployed to Cloud for desktop browsers. Mobile browsers are still being worked on.
fields.summary: change homepage in Atlassian Cloud from JIRA to Confluence (configurable)

fields.description:
Steps to replicate:
* Browse to an OnDemand instance with a user who does not have checkout permissions on SVN repo XXX
* Select the project through the project selection in the top bar
** !project.png!
* Press the reviews tab
* Press create review
* See this error
** !error.png!
fields.summary: Creating a review without the right SVN permissions causes null pointer instead of a nice error message

fields.description:
The version of Crowd currently being used by OnDemand is sensitive to IP changes in certain situations, sometimes causing sessions to be invalidated (users being logged out).

This has been fixed in Crowd but has not been released yet.
* https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CWD-1017

We will keep this issue updated with information about the inclusion of this fix to OnDemand.
fields.summary: Prematurely being logged out of OnDemand after changing IP address

fields.description:
1. Click into Quick Search Input
2. Begin typing until you see some results, i.e. "bas test"
3. In the list of suggestions select one (using the keyboard arrow keys)
4. Press return
You will be taken to the search results screen instead of the search result directly.

When you select the suggested result with the mouse the behavior works as expected.
fields.summary: When I select a suggested result in the Quicksearch, I am NOT taken to the result directly, but to the search results for the typed query

fields.description:
Currently, subtasks display in a parent issue based on order entered. If you want to change order, you must use the arrows to move it up and down in the list, one place at a time.  When you have several subtasks and then choose to input a new one, it can take several minutes to move it into the correct positions. 

Having another method to control the subtask order (e.g. input order placement or drag & drop), would improve our efficiency working with subtasks when additional tasks arise and we want to place them in the general order that they are worked. In our case, we can have a parent with 20-30 subtasks because each customer project implementation is the parent and the subtasks are the individual tasks.  We use this option because it is much quicker to set up a new customer project.  Linking creates duplicate copies of a golden customer implementation issue then you have to delete all the duplicates; using subtasks doesn't do this and it minimizes the need for us to remember and create all of the basic tasks.
fields.summary: Provide another method to to determine subtask order

fields.description:
Today I observe that I cannot log in to my account (ibaltic) on https://studio.atlassian.com using SOAP API. I am perfectly able to log in through the browser. I have double-checked the URL and my password, both are fine. This behaviour was confirmed with another account as well. 

This is a blocker for remote applications that depend on SOAP API, including JIRA Client.

Attaching logs of communication between JIRA Client and JIRA on studio.atlassian.com.
fields.summary: Cannot login using SOAP API to https://studio.atlassian.com

fields.description:
If a user in the administrator group but without access to the Bamboo application clicks on the Builds tab in the admin screens they'll hit the following redirect loop:

!redirect.png!
fields.summary: Accessing Bamboo administration page without application access leads to redirect loop

fields.description:
Currently it is not possible to create an OnDemand-level project (a linked JIRA project, Confluence space, Bamboo project, etc.) through the remote API.

OnDemand should have this capability in order to be used as a platform that can integrate other customers' systems.
fields.summary: Add the ability to create OnDemand-level projects via the remote API

fields.description:
Many feature requests related to workflow modification could be handled using a "Pre Functions" tab in the workflow.
Each transition would have the following tabs:
-Conditions
-Pre Functions
-Validators
-Post Functions

In the "Pre Functions" area, users could have options to add/configure the following:
-Default field value
-Copy value from parent field (for sub-tasks)
-...other issue pre-processing options
fields.summary: Add "Pre Functions" tab to workflow transitions

fields.description: It is suggested that customers should perform this task: [Migrating from JIRA Hosted to Atlassian OnDemand|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AOD/Migrating+from+JIRA+Hosted+to+Atlassian+OnDemand] for few times before the final cut over. However, they get an ERROR (as per screen-shot) that projects exist in the second time as the instance is not wiped out.
fields.summary: "Projects already exist on http://<domain>.onjira.com" when doing a second test migration from EHSP to AOD

fields.description: When you click logout in the dropdown menu, the logout confirmation screen will appear, if you click *Logout* noting happen. Please refer to the attached screenshot
fields.summary: Logout button doesn't work in Chrome 21

fields.description:
When you click on the *Login* buttom in the top right, the login screen will keep refreshing. Please refer to the attached screenshot.

Clearing the cache will only works for one day and it will reoccur again in the next day
fields.summary: The Login screen will keep refreshing in Chrome 21

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

# In a Confluence OnDemand page, insert a *section macro* and put some text like 3 paragraphs, and include an *info* macro inside.

# Save, and that Confluence page will have double scroll bars.

This is only reproduce able when using the documentation theme for Atlassian OnDemand. Not reproduce able in BTF Confluence
fields.summary: When using the info macro inside a section macro, then the Confluence page will have double scroll bars.

fields.description:
Example, go to https://studio.plugins.atlassian.com/wiki/display/ADVMACROS/Confluence+Advanced+Macros

Instead of the page content, there is an error: {{com.atlassian.plugins.PacException}}
fields.summary: Page content is not displaying on https://studio.plugins.atlassian.com due to repository-plugin

fields.description:
Per summary, steps to reproduce:
# Login in FF and make sure the Remember me checkbox is checked.
# Close down FF
# Click a link to an issue from a notification mail
# You are redirected to the login screen.
fields.summary: Remember me is not working when you click on the issue link from the notification emails

fields.description:
In an instance without FishEye OnDemand, the quick search returns the following stack trace upon searching for "r123" or "R123".

fields.description: Currently, custom changes made to default studio mail handler are reverted back upon upgrades, reboots, or jira restarts.  Any adding of regular expressions to customize handler is wiped out in any of these events.
fields.summary: Allow editing, changing, and/or customization of default studio mail handler.

fields.description: As default the Major and Medium priority share the same icon. It would be good if all the priorities had a unique icon as default.
fields.summary: A separate icon for the Medium priority

fields.description:
The JIRA "create user" popup displays an info message that says "There are currently 10 total user(s) set up in JIRA, of which 10 are active and count towards your license limit."
JIRA counts ALL users, including "sysadmin", which in that case (supposing a 10 user license) makes it sound like the customer has reached his user limit which is not true (he can still create one user).
Note that the user can still be created, it's just that the message is confusing and should not include sysadmin in the count.
fields.summary: Misleading info message on user creation popup in JIRA

fields.description: Usernames with [ideographic space|http://www.fileformat.info/info/unicode/char/3000/index.htm] '　' are unable to log in since the release of the new authentication system. The 'invalid credentials' error is thrown, however I've confirmed that the username and password are correct.
fields.summary: Usernames with space-like characters unable to log in

fields.description: Per subject. Is it possible to add a login gadget (linked to Indra Login) ?
fields.summary: Add "Login" gadget to the default dashboard instead of clicking the "Login" button in the top right corner

fields.description:
Submitting a sign up at https://domain.atlassian.net/secure/Signup.jspa yields:

bq. Your session has timed out
fields.summary: OnDemand Signup throws session timeout error

fields.description:
It is possible in JIRA standalone to bulk add watcher with a command in the CLI.
However, this is not available for OnDemand users so it would be good to add this functionality in the UI.
fields.summary: Add a "bulk add watchers" functionality to the UI

fields.description:
Since Thursday, September 13 some customers are reporting problems connecting to their OnDemand JIRA with tools like:
* Eclipse/Mylyn/the [Atlassian IDE connectors|http://www.atlassian.com/software/ide-connectors/overview]
* [JIRA Client Lite|http://almworks.com/jiraclient/overview.html]

This coincides with the deployment of the [new login interface|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AOD/Atlassian+OnDemand+release+summary#AtlassianOnDemandreleasesummary-10September2012] and it is believed to be related to the problem.
fields.summary: Unable to connect to JIRA with an external tool

fields.description:
The network tab on the the mobile interface does not appear to be showing the most recent updates.
For example, on the Web UI for Confluence OnDemand the most recent update was "47 minutes ago", but on the mobile UI it it is only showing the last update at 8.53pm yesterday.
Also, no attachment activity is being shown (I'm not sure if this is intentional?).
I'm in the AEST (Sydney) time zone, so I was wondering if it was a date filtering issue?
fields.summary: The Network tab is not showing the most recent network activity or attachment activity

fields.description:
When using a kanban board and viewing a specific issue, I can add a link, but I cannot remove it. 
When viewing subtasks though, you can add and delete. It would be helpful to have both of these same actions for links.
fields.summary: Provide ability to remove links when viewing an issue in board

fields.description: When you create an issue, you have the option to Create Another.  When you use that option, the summary clears, which is understandable, since that is usually unique. However, currently, if you linked other items to the issues, those selections clear as well.  It would be beneficial to also have linked issue inputs maintained instead of being cleared.
fields.summary: Maintain Linked Issues inputs when using the Create Another option

fields.description: We have a need to be able to hide certain fields for customers that also have access to our installation. According to an earlier ticket (https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JST-36881) there is a plugin that solves this, but it is not available in OnDemand. Please make it available.
fields.summary: Bundle JIRA Field Security Plugin

fields.description:
Hello,

We are using the hosted jira solution and we're trying to report issues directly via the API from a Silverlight application. However, since the application is on a different domain, Silverlight requires the web server to serve a clientaccesspolicy.xml file granting access.

It would be great if you could add this file so that Silverlight apps could use the API. I guess this can be either a blanket solution (applies to everyone) or maybe a configurable setting in the settings.

Thanks!
fields.summary: Add clientaccesspolicy.xml file to server so the API can be accessed from Silverlight

fields.description:
Hi Guys, 

Among the many improvements you are working on ... I think it will be useful to have the ability to add / respond to a comment with a comment. 
Please see example below ... hopefully this will make sense. 

Thank you


||Current comments flow ||

*Alex Mulas* added a comment - 09/Aug/12 9:11 AM
Please can you update the code for payment option

*Alex Mulas* added a comment - 09/Aug/12 9:27
Please can you change the payment option values

*Michelle Nicholson* added a comment - 09/Aug/12 11:00 AM 
@ code for payment option. This has been done, please check now
@ payment option value. How do you want to change the values?

*Alex Mulas* added a comment - 28/Aug/12 11:42 AM 
@ code for payment option. Thanks I'll check

*Alex Mulas* added a comment - 06/Sep/12 3:42 PM 
@ payment option value. Please make it 500

How do you want to change the values?

Please make it 500|
fields.summary: Comments: add a comment to a comment

fields.description: We've had requests from customers who have company names that are 5 or 4 characters to reduce the character limit... right now the minimum number of characters is 6
fields.summary: Reduce character limit for minimum number of characters for your ondemand domain

fields.description:
We would like to activate Subversion JIRA plugin in our OnDemand account (https://studio.plugins.atlassian.com/wiki/display/SVN/Subversion+JIRA+plugin).
Can this be done for us, or can you explane how to do it?

Our account:
Name :	depersgroepdigital
SEN  :	SEN-2160937
URL  :	http://depersgroepdigital.atlassian.net
fields.summary: Subversion JIRA plugin

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 17 September 2014|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
Hi everyone,
 
Thanks so much for your votes and comments on this issue.
 
Atlassian is working hard on Atlassian Connect, Atlassian's strategic integration platform enabling ecosystem vendors to develop add-ons for Atlassian Cloud (OnDemand). Atlassian Connect 1.0 [was released in March 2014|http://blogs.atlassian.com/2014/03/introducing-atlassian-connect-1-0/], and you can already get access to [more than 50 public add-ons today built using the platform|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/search?application=&category=&cost=&hosting=cloud&marketingLabel=].
 
Due to stability and scalability reasons, we will not bundle additional third party add-ons with our Cloud offerings. But you should feel free to contact the vendors of your favourite add-ons to let them know that you would like them to create a Cloud version of the add-on! We will do our best to work together with the vendor to satisfy this request.
 
Since we have no plans to bundle additional add-ons in Cloud, we are closing this issue.
 
Cheers,
Bartek
JIRA Product Management
bartek (at) atlassian (dot) com
{panel}
 
 
*Original request description:*
As an entrepreneur I would like to use the Zen Foundation Plugin so that I can leverage our Atlassian OnDemand instance and do not have to buy yet another Web-Content-Management-System (web-CMS). 

Moving to a download version is not an option as I do not want to create IT overhead but keep things simple. 

References:
* https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.zenfoundation 
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AOD/Atlassian+OnDemand+Plugin+Policy
* https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/78924/please-how-can-i-install-zen-foundation-in-on-demand-version
* http://blogs.atlassian.com/2010/02/make_your_confluence_wiki_public/#comment-73048
fields.summary: Support Zen Foundation Plugin for Atlassian OnDemand

# Click the "Wiki" tab if it is not selected.

fields.summary: Illegal State Exception when deleting a Confluence space tied to a JIRA project

fields.description: Found on a studio environment in onDemand.
fields.summary: Unable to add user picture if the user only has permissions to access Confluence

fields.description: Slow performance in Safari 6 due to that nginx servers forcibly close connections after every single request for it , see this [thread|http://www.ruby-forum.com/topic/485470] for more information.
fields.summary: Slow performance in Safari 6 due to the SSL negotiation

fields.description:
When the user adds the email POP conf in *Mail Archive* (wiki/mail/archive/viewmailarchive.action?key=xxx) page, the following error occurs:
{noformat}
Cause

java.lang.RuntimeException: Error rendering template for decorator root
    at com.atlassian.confluence.setup.velocity.ApplyDecoratorDirective.render(ApplyDecoratorDirective.java:186)

caused by: java.lang.RuntimeException: Error rendering template for decorator spaceadminpanel
    at com.atlassian.confluence.setup.velocity.ApplyDecoratorDirective.render(ApplyDecoratorDirective.java:186)

caused by: org.apache.velocity.exception.MethodInvocationException: Invocation of method 'getBreadcrumbs' in class com.atlassian.confluence.themes.GlobalHelper threw exception java.lang.NullPointerException at /breadcrumbs.vm[line 4, column 34]
    at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTIdentifier.execute(ASTIdentifier.java:223)

caused by: java.lang.NullPointerException
    at com.atlassian.confluence.mail.archive.actions.MailActionBreadcrumb$MailArchiveBreadcrumb.<init>(MailActionBreadcrumb.java:51)
{noformat}

Screenshots are provided for the error
fields.summary: Error upon adding the email POP account in the Mail Archive page (Confluence 5.0)

fields.description:
I would like to be able to provide the encrypted master password for maven e.g as a global variable, so I could specify encrypted passwords for deployment goals.

For Maven password encryption reference, see
http://maven.apache.org/guides/mini/guide-encryption.html
fields.summary: Setting Maven master password

fields.description:
The current pre-commit hook for Subversion only checks the existance of a valid JIRA issue key.
I believe it should also check if the issue is in "In Progress" state (or in a specified state for custom workflows) and if it is assigned to the committee, i.e. a developer should only commit to his current tasks.
I realize, not everyone would want this, so it should be configurable in the administration page, same place where this hook can be enabled/disabled.
fields.summary: Subversion pre-commit hook should check more attributes of the JIRA issue

fields.description:
Since the update to Confluence 4.3 *(AOD Confluence Only)* the site is automatically sending a notification to new users, even though having unchecked the send email box.

Attached is a screenshot of the *add users* screen.
fields.summary: Sending new user notification email even though the box is not checked

fields.description: When the Activity Bar is enabled, content underneath it is inaccesible. This includes the tips at the bottom of the Wiki Page editor, and the Tempo tracker. As the Activity Bar cannot be disabled or moved in the settings, a user cannot access content hidden underneath the bar.
fields.summary: Google apps Activity Bar obscures content

fields.description:
This is caused by the fact that mod_proxy modifies the URI when forwarding requests to FeCru [FE-4113|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/FE-4113]. 

The correct configuration documented in [FishEye AJPv13 Authentication|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/AJPv13+Authentication] states that the "nocanon" option should be used.
fields.summary: FeCru shows an error dialog when browsing a file name that contains a plus "+" sign in its path

fields.description: After the upgrade to JIRA *5.1* the "Administer Project" link is no longer available inside an issue screen (as per screenshot attached).
fields.summary: Lost "Administer Project" link inside an issue

fields.description:
I cannot add a "Two Dimensional Filter" to a dashboard. I tried deleting my first attempt, reloaded the page, etc.

Gadget
http://snag.gy/2YEKr.jpg

Debug output:
http://snag.gy/huzZT.jpg
fields.summary: Getting a 500 Server Error When Attempting to Save a "Two Dimensional Filter" Gadget

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 17 September 2014|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
Hi everyone,
 
Thanks so much for your votes and comments on this issue.
 
Atlassian is working hard on Atlassian Connect, Atlassian's strategic integration platform enabling ecosystem vendors to develop add-ons for Atlassian Cloud (OnDemand). Atlassian Connect 1.0 [was released in March 2014|http://blogs.atlassian.com/2014/03/introducing-atlassian-connect-1-0/], and you can already get access to [more than 50 public add-ons today built using the platform|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/search?application=&category=&cost=&hosting=cloud&marketingLabel=].
 
Due to stability and scalability reasons, we will not bundle additional third party add-ons with our Cloud offerings. But you should feel free to contact the vendors of your favourite add-ons to let them know that you would like them to create a Cloud version of the add-on! We will do our best to work together with the vendor to satisfy this request.
 
Since we have no plans to bundle additional add-ons in Cloud, we are closing this issue.
 
Cheers,
Bartek
JIRA Product Management
bartek (at) atlassian (dot) com
{panel}
 
 
*Original request description:*
Please bundle issue to issue copy plugin for OnDemand
https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.cpji.cpji-jira-plugin
fields.summary: Please bundle issue to issue copy plugin for OnDemand

fields.description:
the only column constraint (besides none) is "issue count"

i'd like to use story points or user story here.
fields.summary: greenhopper agile rapid board column constraint should be customizable

fields.description:
Customers have the need to change the footer in OnDemand, which right now reads "Powered by Atlassian"
Please make it customizable
fields.summary: Make footer customizable

fields.description:
We would like to reverse the order comments system on pages from new to old, instead of the default old to new.

This would be very welcome as feature. Current sort order is a bit unlogic, old comments have priority above new ones.

Many thanks,

Sander
fields.summary: Reverse comments on wiki Confluence

Please bundle the Go2Group plugin for OnDemand
https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/G2G-GA-CONF
fields.summary: Bundle Go2Group for OnDemand

fields.description:
Currently when a product exceed users limit, the administrator of the environment doesn't get any notification about it. He will only be knowing if checking the application access page (or when he get stuck of doing something because of the exceeded users).

As an administrator, would be nice to see a notice on the top of admin's dashboard (or something) and receive an email telling to remove users (because of the product which exceeded users limit) or to contact sales to add more user licenses.
fields.summary: Prompt administrator when a product exceed users limit

fields.description: Please bundle the Eclipse Connector for OnDemand
fields.summary: Bundle Eclipse Connector Plugin for OnDemand

fields.description:
h2. Problem:

1. SVN Import a file.
2. Make some commits against SVN repository.
3. SVN import another file.

You get this error:
{noformat}
Error importing file "studio-svn-backup-xxxx.xx.xxx-xxxx.dmp.gz" at <time> PM: CleanDirectoryCommand: failed to execute command /bin/rm -rf '/data/jirastudio/svn/root.back':

error code is: 1 
error message: /bin/rm: cannot remove directory `/data/jirastudio/svn/root.back/root/dav/activities.d': Permission denied 
{noformat}
fields.summary: SVN Import fails with CleanDirectoryCommand: failed. activities.d Permission denied.

fields.description:
Consider this use case:
* JIRA + Confluence 
** private issue tracker
** mostly private wiki with a few spaces allowing anonymous access for public documentation

Currently if an anonymous user visits an OnDemand site like this they'll receive a blank dashboard with no tabs. If the anonymous users manually types in the /wiki part they'll see the public spaces.

This request is to provide either a redirect or a 'self-aware' wiki tab that will show up if anonymous access is enabled.

Additionally users may not have access to JIRA with JIRA + Confluence. Currently they will be directed to JIRA, told they do not have access, and will have to resort to manually typing /wiki to gain access to Confluence
fields.summary: Ability to redirect to /wiki by default with JIRA + Confluence
JIRA 5.1 story -- The last info box still covers up the drop down when you start typing description.  Can you please lower it a bit

fields.description: 1 - For companies that own AU for JIRA, the text still says - "JIRA 5.1 Sneak Peak» Want a sneak peak of inline editing on JIRA 5.1? Take the lesson today. This week only!"  I am worried that we will get helpspot tickets from people that are worried that the lessons will go away.  Can you change it to "JIRA 5.1» A supplement to JIRA 5.0"
fields.summary: Rename JIRA lesson for companies that already have JIRA.

fields.description: The menu and page serves no purpose in OnDemand as everything is done via Trustedapps and no external gadgets are allowed.
fields.summary: Remove the OAuth Access Tokens menu item in user profile

fields.description:
Instead of columns being equally distributed in a PDF export, allow the user to define the width as a percentage of the page. Today, if you had two columns, the PDF export automatically creates 50% and 50%.  Provide the user the ability to set a width for each, such as 20% and 80%. 
This allows a tech writer to create tables that do not inappropriately use the real-estate and seem odd to the reader. For example, the first column is an image or a label and the second column a description. There is no reason, and it appears odd, when the first column is half the width of the table.
fields.summary: Provide ability to set percentage of page width for a table column

fields.description:
"There was a communication problem" in search results under Source field if some of the repositories are "Disabled" or "Stopped" in Fisheye/Source.

Attached are screenshot for the problem in detailed.
fields.summary: "There was a communication problem" in search results under Source field if some of the repositories are "Disabled" or "Stopped" in Fisheye/Source

fields.description:
In OnDemand the permission to commit is linked to the permission to create a review.
However, depending on the internal processes of the company developers should not be able to create reviews.
The ideal set up would be similar to the standalone version of crucible where both the permissions are unrelated.
fields.summary: Split commit permission from create review permission in FeCru OnDemand

fields.description: https://img.skitch.com/20120718-pu2n6qjyibk5difrqr27cprc3r.png
fields.summary: Cannot change version from planning board

*Original request description:*
We have been using TeamCity for continuous integration within one of our projects for some time. Having brought version control and issue management into Atlassian / JIRA it is now critical that we continue and integrate TeamCity capability for this solution.

Please can I request that we have JIRA TeamCity available as a plugin for OnDemand / Studio as a matter of urgency.
fields.summary: JIRA TeamCity (Stiltsoft)  integration for OnDemand / Studio

fields.description:
Large backup downloads (e.g. created by backup manager) through the WebDAV interface usually stops at 1GB.

h4. Workarounds

* Download using a download manager e.g. Firefox's [DownThemAll|https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/addon/downthemall/].
* Use the Bash script shared in the comment [below|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/AOD-5975?focusedCommentId=397037&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-397037].
* Use the 'wget' command as suggested [below|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/AOD-5975?focusedCommentId=472783&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-472783].
fields.summary: Large backup downloads time out, causing incomplete files.

fields.description:
We have a tickets on SAC where customers are having issues with subversion falling over when trying to checkout a large repository. 
We've had a good look, but we can't figure out the cause of the problem. Apparently this issue has been encountered on sdog by one of our developers too.
fields.summary: svn falling over for large transfers

fields.description:
After writing a heading like "2012-06-10" in a confluence's page, when saving the page it shows up as a link. In edit mode, the text is just plain text without any link associated to it. See images bellow:

* Writing the text (edit mode):

!edit-mode-text.png!

* After saving the page:

!page-text-link.png!

Also, the link is poiting to a bamboo build that doesn't exist. In this case https://brosa.jira-dev.com/builds/browse/2012-07-10

!page-not-found.png!

*The same behavior doesn't happen in confluence standalone.*
fields.summary: Heading incorrectly turns into a Link in Confluence

fields.description: Tried to move an issue from any state to another. There is no error message. The screen directly hangs up. Tried with different persons from three different computers.
fields.summary: Greenhopper hangs up by moving issues on the task board

fields.description: Looks like this problem comes back, see [AOD-3847]. This happens in Firefox 11, 13 and IE9. Does not happen in Chrome.
fields.summary: Navigate away from a quick search yields warning in Firefox and IE

fields.description:
The Google Documents List macro in Confluence just spins and never loads. 

To replicate just edit a page on a Google Apps enabled instance and insert the 'Google Documents List' macro.
fields.summary: Google Documents List macro never loads
HTML broken on Introduction Gadget on JIRA OnDemand 5.0.7rc1

fields.description: All new ondemand domains are created as <instance-name>.atlassian.net. Currently we have only *.jira.com listed as openid realm in application-manifest.xml. This forces the customers to enable openid login to any relaying party, which is something some of them do not want to do
fields.summary: Fix openid realm whitelisting for atlassian.net instances

fields.description:
Symptoms:
- Not able to set application access for some users. https://instance/secure/admin/user/ViewUser.jspa?name=username lacks the normal checkboxes.  User also does not show up in the Application Access section.
- Application Access (https://instance/secure/admin/user/ApplicationAccessConfig!default.jspa) does not show any users.


Workaround:
- Support is able to grant access by updating group memberships via Crowd
fields.summary: Investigate application access issue post release 153

fields.description:
HTML in [Introduction] gadget doesn't render. This was working yesterday before v5.0.6#733 was pushed last night (02/Jul/12 8:29 PM)

Updating the introduction text made no difference.
fields.summary: HTML in [Introduction] gadget not rendering after v5.0.6#733 upgrade

fields.description: Upgrade the Crowd web app in the Fireball from 2.2.9 to the current production release, 2.4.3.
fields.summary: Upgrade Crowd to 2.4.4

fields.description:
When trying to upload the svn dump (gzipped), i get timeout error al the times.
I was able to upload the svn, but i throw an error because 1 repo was missing. After uploading the new dump, i keep on getting the same error.
fields.summary: Timeout when trying to import svn dump

fields.description: It would be interesting a page that customers could check what are the versions of each bundled plugin into OnDemand and when (and to what version) it will be upgraded in the next OnDemand upgrades.
fields.summary: Page for checking/tracking versions and future upgrades of the plugins that are bundled in Atlassian OnDemand

fields.description:
When i try to import my svn repository, i get the following error.


Error importing file repo.gzip into the Atlassian OnDemand Subversion repository:

Error importing file "repo.gzip" at 6/27/12 12:39 PM: GetMaxRevisionCommand: Error executing command strings '/data/jirastudio/webdav/dump_files/repo.gzip' | grep '^Revision-number:' | tail -n1:

no output
fields.summary: Subversion importer cannot detect gzipped files with names that do not end with ".gz"

fields.description:
I clicked a link to:

https://sdog.jira.com/secure/RapidBoard.jspa?rapidView=16&view=detail&selectedIssue=SP-23

Had to login. Got redirected to:

https://sdog.jira.com/secure/RapidBoard.jspa%3FrapidView%3D16%26view%3Ddetail%26selectedIssue%3DSP-23
fields.summary: Unsuccessful redirect to GreenHopper board when not logged in

fields.description:
*Steps to reproduce:*

- Create a new project with name "FOO" and key "FOO"
- Verify in FishEye that a repository with the name "FOO" is also created
- Import some code under the subversion repository "FOO"
- Verify that you can check the code out with a regular svn client
- Delete the OnDemand project using these instructions (https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AOD/Deleting+a+project)
- Verify in FishEye that the repository "FOO" no longer appears
- Create a new project re-using the name "FOO" and key "FOO"

*Current behavior:*

The previous content will be automatically re-added. 

*Expected behavior:*

The previous content was removed when the project was deleted.

If you manually remove the directory {{/data/jirastudio/fisheye/home/var/cache/FOO}} the content will be deleted.

May be the same bug than this one: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/FE-2017 (that was fixed on the version 2.1.4). The same does not occur on FECRU 2.7.10 Standalone.
fields.summary: Fisheye does not remove cache after removing a repository in AoD

fields.description: If a user has the 'administer project' permission in JIRA they can get into the Atlassian OnDemand administration menu, but clicking on most links will just produce a 'permission denied' screen. To make the experience less confusing it would be nice if users could only see links that they could actually click on.
fields.summary: Hide administration options if users don't have permission to click them

fields.description:
In application access, some instances have this (harmless) error indicating they have exceeded license for applications that they are not subscribed to. See screenshot.

*Possible side effect*:

It was reported that this may also break user deletion from OnDemand. The deleted user will reappear after the next user synchronisation.

*Possible root cause:*

During evaluation period, subscription may include all the apps. When it's converted to commercial license, the membership remains intact in Crowd. In this case, JIRA+Confluence+FishEye+Bamboo was converted to JIRA-only OnDemand.

*Workaround:*

This is due to some users being part of the {{_licensed-appname}} group. Removing the affected users from these groups in Crowd (and res-sync user directory in JIRA) will dismiss the error. Please contact support if you wish to apply this workaround.
fields.summary: Misleading "exceeded" license in application access

fields.description: VertygoSLA would be very helpful to implement an SLA measurement for JIRA OnDemand process.
fields.summary: Bundle VertigoSLA plugin into OnDemand instances

fields.description: I have created this project successfully, but cannot view it (although I am a member of Administrator group).
fields.summary: Cannot access http://support.onixs.biz/browse/NETLSETRADING - "Permission Violation" is reported

fields.description: As a user of the Bonfire extension, when I open Bonfire to create a new issue, I want the most recently used Bonfire template to be selected automatically.  When I accidentally forget to select a template, I don't realize until later that the issue I created doesn't have the fields filled out as I expected.
fields.summary: Remember last-used Bonfire template

fields.description:
Hi, as per https://developers.google.com/speed/spdy/mod_spdy/ - SPDY can we enabled on Apache servers. Can this please be enabled on the OnDemand instances for faster performance? It can potentially also save some bandwidth due to compression used.

It is widely supported by Chrome and Firefox.

Thanks.
fields.summary: Support SPDY

fields.description: When using the Google Spreadsheet macro, to display a Google spreadsheet into Confluence, a table is displayed with an empty first column that does not exist in the original document. This column should not be displayed and it takes a lot of space on the screen.
fields.summary: Strange first column displayed when adding a spreadsheet from Google Docs

fields.description:
Since many gadgets and reports can be based on project categories, it would be helpful to be able to allow a project to be associated with more than one category. 
For example, we have projects that we categorize as Products.  We would like to also categorize as subset of those projects as Capitalized or as Outsourced.  

This would allow us to use the many gadgets and reporting available based on that category since it is the project that is a category - not individual issues that could be labeled within that category.
fields.summary: Allow a project to be associated with more than one category

fields.description:
See screenshot
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AOD/Working+with+Activities
fields.summary: Broken Gallery on Activities doc page
Update 149 breaks POP/IMAP connection.

fields.description:
Confluence should have a "Default Space Template" feature, in which you can setup default pages/content, theme etc., for new spaces.
Alternatively (or as a short-term hotfix) the _Copy Space Plugin_ ([https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.confluence.plugin.copyspace]) could be added to the OnDemand solution, partially making it possible to setup a default template, just as a prototype space.
fields.summary: Default Space Template

fields.description:
It happens a lot of times that Jira data is imported which if older then version 4.3. When this is the case the import will fail and users are not imported.
There are more types of issues that can occur when importing older data.

If the importer could detect this and provide an error instead of simply importing the data it would save a lot issues and time.
Additionally there should be a warning on the main page of the importer mentioning this.

Advisable work-around is to upgrade the data to Jira 5.0.x before importing the data.
fields.summary: Jira importer needs to check the data version
Confluence user unable to change JIRA profile picture

fields.description:
It would reduce the amount of time to setup and maintain field configurations if we had the ability to bulk configure fields.  For example, ability to select several fields to hide or show. 
Currently, our default field configuration has 100s of fields and every time we create a new field configuration, we have to hide the majority of fields.  Hiding and showing is only done one field at a time and the screen refreshes each time. So, it is scroll to find field > Hide > screen refreshes > scroll down to find the next field > Hide > screen refreshes.
fields.summary: Ability to bulk configure fields in a field configuration

fields.description:
Compare the OnDemand Administration UI to the Standalone UIs for the administration. It's very confusing and non-functional.

E.g. in JIRA standalone there are the dropdowns on top and the proper sections. In OnDemand the sections are totally different (sorted differently) and the way it works and where everything is located is very non-intuitive.

This applies for all OnDemand applications. Can it be made closer to the standalone versions or if not at least less confusing and jumpy. I find a huge productivity decrease when administering an OnDemand instance.
fields.summary: Administration Menu very confusing compared to Standalone versions

fields.description: As described in [TOC-64|https://studio.plugins.atlassian.com/browse/TOC-64] the TOC and Dynamic Tasklist macros to not work on the same page. This has been fixed in the Table of Contents plugin v2.5.12 which is not bundled with Confluence 4.2. Would be nice to have it bundled then.
fields.summary: Add plugin Table of Contents 2.5.12 for Confluence OnDemand in order to fix TOC and Dynamic Tasklist macros
WebDAV request returns 500 Internal Server Error

fields.description:
In Confluence OnDemand,

If you go to Wiki->Configuration->General Configuration...
Hover down to "Did You Mean (English Only)" - there is a link to a Confluence page where you can build your indexes.
However, there is no other place that allows you to build indexes. This is confusing and strange as you are now stuck in a menu that is not shown on the left nav and nowhere to go back to.
Either disable this functionality if it's not intended for OnDemand usage OR to put an indexes section for re-indexing etc like JIRA OnDemand.

Thanks.
fields.summary: Rebuilding Indexes in Confluence OnDemand

fields.description:
It'd be good if we can make use of the big spare space that the Atlassian OnDemand banner has taken up. Besides the projects drop down, the tabs and the small logo on the left, there is a big space remaining for most users.

Perhaps we can have an image logo in the background instead of just setting a colour option? It'd be a good branding/customisation allowing users to have a big banner across the back.
fields.summary: Image Logo/Banner on OnDemand Banner

fields.description:
I would like to request the inclusion of the [Snippet macro|https://studio.plugins.atlassian.com/wiki/display/SNIP/Confluence+Snippet+Plugin] in some future release (please)?

I've used this macro at previous sites and is a great aid to maintain (coding) documentation.

Please advise, if there is some other alternative (provided in the JiraStudio/OnDemand offering) that provides similar features.
fields.summary: Snippet Plugin for Confluence

fields.description:
Once you set the Confluence Administrator permission on Confluence Global permissions there is no drop-down option for the Admin page on Confluence although the users have access through the link below:

https://instancename/wiki/admin/console.action
fields.summary: Confluence Administrator permission doesn't show any link to the admin page
